title: MS AccessCount()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessCount()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the number of products in the "Products" table:
SELECT Count(ProductID) AS NumberOfProducts FROM Products;

Definition and Usage
The Count() function returns the number of records returned by a select query.
Note:
NULL values are not counted.
Syntax
Count(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. A field or a string value
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

quiz.question: What is NULL values?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of NULL values is 'not counted'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessCount()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessCount()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessCount()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
